item.title: Rapid and Extensive Summer Growth around base to trunk, 5th July
item.description:
Huge summer expanse in growth around base of from roots to canopy along trunk. Arterial blockage to pathway for pedestrian (adult/children alike) and all whom require mobility to amenities and residence. Requires cutting back and clean up of bushing out trunk branches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fraser Road, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Damage on road is causing very noisy lorries, 5th July
item.description:
There’s an issue along this section of road that is causing very loud noises when heavy lorries or buses pass by. It’s difficult to say what is causing it, it’s like hearing two thuds in quick succession and is happening daily
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Crayford, London

item.title: Vegetation encroaching - alleyway Silverdale to Ravenscourt, 4th July
item.description:
Please could vegetation be pruned along the length of the alleyway between Silverdale Road and Chipperfield Road. This includes basal growth on trees in the cul-de-sac of Ravenscourt Road, hedging outside 244 Chipperfield, hedging and ivy along the alleyway, and creepers, trees, etc including along the boundary of 18 Silverdale Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Hill, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outdoor furniture obstructing pedestrian path, 4th July
item.description:
Tables and chairs have been placed outside Buzz Coffee, located at the corner of West End Lane and the side alley beside 217 West End Lane, NW6 1XJ. The furniture often extends into the narrow side passage, well beyond their frontage, blocking the pedestrian route and creating an obstruction. This setup appears intermittently, but the obstruction occurs regularly enough to cause concern. Please investigate whether permission has been granted for such use of the public footpath. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West End Lane, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 262-276, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Finsbury Park concert security, 4th July
item.description:
I was trying to walk home tonight from Finsbury Park station to my flat in Digby Crescent. Me and another resident, despite showing ID, were shouted at, pushed back and refused entry by Marshalls at the end of this street. Lots of conflicting messages.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Somerfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole, 4th July
item.description:
